## Overall Highlights

- The U.S. has issued warnings regarding air travel over Venezuela due to escalating military tensions.
- Several airlines, including Iberia, have canceled flights to Venezuela following U.S. advisories.
- NicolÃ¡s Maduro has called for peace and dialogue, urging Venezuelan students to connect with their American counterparts.
- The U.S. is reportedly preparing for new operations against the Maduro regime, indicating a potential escalation in its approach.
- Venezuela has responded by restricting commercial flights in light of U.S. warnings.

<!--more-->

## Venezuelan Perspective (Venezuelan Sources)

- The U.S. has raised alerts regarding the safety of flights over Venezuela, causing airlines to cancel routes.
- Maduro urges Venezuelan students to reach out to U.S. peers to advocate for peace amidst rising tensions.
- Venezuela has implemented restrictions on commercial flights in response to U.S. warnings about military activity.

## United States Perspective (United States Sources)

- The FAA has warned pilots to exercise caution when flying over Venezuela due to heightened military activity.
- U.S. military operations in the Caribbean are being prepared as tensions with Venezuela escalate.
- Six airlines have canceled flights to Venezuela following U.S. security warnings about the airspace.
- Reports suggest that the U.S. is considering regime change in Venezuela as part of its strategy moving forward.
